item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, September 1, 2024 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Honey, I shrunk {fmt}: bringing binary size to 14k and ditching the C++ runtime (50 points | 6 comments)
2. Building LLMs from the Ground Up: A 3-Hour Coding Workshop (607 points | 57 comments)
3. Founder Mode (58 points | 14 comments)
4. Playstation 2 GS emulation – the final frontier of Vulkan compute emulation (109 points | 23 comments)
5. Taming the beast that is the Django ORM – An introduction (109 points | 57 comments)
6. Harder Drive: hard drives we didn't want, or need (2022) [video] (341 points | 59 comments)
7. Did your car witness a crime? (223 points | 459 comments)
8. Making an atomic trampoline [video] (94 points | 28 comments)

10. The Null Pointer (34 points | 3 comments)
11. The Atari 7800 (30 points | 7 comments)
12. A brief history of barbed wire fence telephone networks (76 points | 8 comments)
13. E Ink faces growing competition in the "paper-like" display space (35 points | 13 comments)
14. Percona Everest: open-source automated database provisioning and management (66 points | 29 comments)
15. WatchYourLAN: Lightweight Network IP Scanner (139 points | 12 comments)
16. Astronomers puzzled by little red galaxies that seem impossibly dense (58 points | 36 comments)
17. Client-side QR code generator with SVG output (107 points | 22 comments)

19. Epilepsy Protection for VRChat (24 points | 2 comments)
20. The papers that most heavily cite retracted studies (4 points | discuss)
21. Show HN: A retro terminal text editor for GNU/Linux coded in C (C-edit) (148 points | 37 comments)
22. Non-Determinism and Overcount on Modern Hardware Performance Counters [pdf] (24 points | 1 comment)
23. Show HN: Typeform alternative, turns Markdown to forms (156 points | 63 comments)
24. Lucee: A light-weight dynamic CFML scripting language for the JVM (68 points | 25 comments)
25. Ask HN: What books should I read to improve as a software engineer? (99 points | 79 comments)
26. Neutral beam microscopy using magnetic beam spin encoding (26 points | discuss)
27. Continue (YC S23) Is Hiring a Software Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
28. Solution to the puzzle Cat Walk (10 points | discuss)
29. Is my vision that bad? No, it's just a bug in Apple's Calculator (589 points | 363 comments)
30. Buy, Borrow, Die – Explained (449 points | 357 comments)
